item.title: 价格飙升后，沙特阿拉伯下令冻结利雅得房租
item.description: 沙特王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）在誓言制止 "不可接受的 "房地产价格上涨几周后，下令在未来五年内冻结首都利雅得的房租上涨。【原文：Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered a freeze on rent increases in the capital of Riyadh for the next five years, just weeks after vowing to halt an “unacceptable” rise in property prices.】

item.title: 华尔街关注 IPO 跟踪器，新上市股票数量居 S&P 500 指数之首
item.description: 寻找华尔街下一个热门交易的股票多头们越来越多地转向今年美国市场最繁忙的角落--首次公开募股。【原文：Stock bulls looking for the next hot Wall Street trade are increasingly turning to the busiest corner of the US market this year — initial public offerings.】

item.title: 马斯克的 Grok 人工智能获准在美国政府机构中使用
item.description: 美国总务管理局（General Services Administration）周四宣布，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的xAI公司签署了一项新协议，将其人工智能聊天机器人Grok的使用权扩展到联邦政府。【原文：Elon Musk’s xAI signed a new agreement to expand access to its artificial intelligence chatbot Grok to the federal government, the General Services Administration announced Thursday.】

item.title: 亿万富翁小米创始人发布售价 630 美元的 iPhone 17
item.description: 小米公司的亿万富翁联合创始人发布了一款售价630美元的智能手机，旨在与刚刚发布的iPhone 17一较高下，凸显了这家中国公司更广泛的野心，即与从苹果公司到特斯拉公司等美国竞争对手一较高下。【原文：Xiaomi Corp.’s billionaire co-founder unveiled a $630 smartphone designed to take on the just-released iPhone 17, underscoring the Chinese company’s broader ambitions to take on US rivals from Apple Inc. to Tesla Inc.】

item.title: 农作物贸易商威尔玛公司称印尼法院推翻无罪判决
item.description: 亚洲食品巨头威玛国际有限公司（Wilmar International Ltd.）称，印尼最高法院撤销了在一起出口案件中对三大棕榈油集团的无罪判决，几个月前该公司曾被迫在判决前交出 11.9 万亿印尼盾（当时约合 7.29 亿美元）作为保证金。【原文：Asian food titan Wilmar International Ltd. said the Indonesian Supreme Court quashed the acquittals of three major palm oil groups in an export case, several months after the company was forced to hand over 11.9 trillion rupiah (about $729 million at the time) as a security deposit ahead of the ruling.】

item.title: 集装箱运价降至红海改道以来最低点
item.description: 自近两年前胡塞武装在红海发动袭击，导致全球大部分海运船队绕道南部非洲以来，从中国用集装箱向北欧运输货物的成本降至最低水平。【原文：The cost to ship goods in containers to northern Europe from China fell to the lowest level since Houthi attacks in the Red Sea started diverting most of the world’s maritime fleet around southern Africa almost two years ago.】

item.title: 美国首次申请失业救济人数降至七月以来最低水平
item.description: 美国首次申请失业救济的人数降至 7 月中旬以来的最低点，这凸显出企业仍然不愿裁员。【原文：Initial applications for jobless benefits in the US fell to the lowest since mid-July, underscoring how companies remain reticent to lay off workers.】

item.title: 美国经济以近两年来最快速度增长，主要得益于消费者支出
item.description: 由于政府上调了之前对消费者支出的估计，美国第二季度经济增长速度达到近两年来最快。【原文：The US economy grew in the second quarter at the fastest pace in nearly two years as the government revised up its previous estimate of consumer spending.】

item.title: 俄罗斯计划年底前禁止向经销商出口柴油
item.description: 由于乌克兰无人机袭击了俄罗斯的炼油厂，俄罗斯政府计划在年底前禁止一些公司出口柴油。【原文：Russia’s government plans to ban diesel exports for some companies until the end of the year amid Ukrainian drone strikes on nation’s refineries.】

item.title: 毛里求斯总统任命塔库尔为新任中央银行行长
item.description: 毛里求斯政府任命了中央银行的新行长和第二副行长，这些变动旨在结束该机构数月来的内部争斗。【原文：The Mauritian government appointed a new governor and second deputy governor of the central bank, changes that are aimed at bringing an end to months of internal wrangling at the institution.】

item.title: 莫菲特称 Alphabet 是人工智能领域 "最有价值的公司
item.description: 根据 MoffettNathanson 的报告，Alphabet 公司在规模上落后于其他几家巨型科技公司，但鉴于其在人工智能和其他关键领域的强大地位，谷歌母公司可能注定要超越它们。【原文：Alphabet Inc. trails behind a few other megacap technology companies in size, but the Google parent may be destined to overtake them given its strong position in artificial intelligence and other key sectors, according to MoffettNathanson.】

item.title: 美联储主席米兰称美国经济脆弱需要快速缩表
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬-米兰（Stephen Miran）表示，美国央行如果不迅速采取行动降低利率，就有可能对经济造成损害。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said the US central bank risks damage to the economy by not moving rapidly to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 沙特股市改革有望推动资金流向小型公司
item.description: 由于沙特计划放宽对上市公司的外资持股限制，沙特的中型企业很可能与银行一起吸引资金流入。【原文：Saudi medium-size companies are likely to attract flows alongside banks on the back of the kingdom’s plan to loosen foreign ownership limits for public companies.】

item.title: 交易所库存降至 18 个月低点，阿拉比卡咖啡价格上涨
item.description: 阿拉比卡咖啡期货在纽约上涨，因为交易所库存降至近 18 个月以来的最低水平。【原文：Arabica coffee futures rose in New York as exchange inventories fell to their lowest level in nearly 18 months.】

item.title: 特朗普的钢铁关税引发美国邻国对中国的反击
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策对全球钢铁制造商造成了惩罚性打击，包括墨西哥、巴西和加拿大在内的国家正在反击—；但美国并不是他们唯一的目标。【原文：As Donald Trump’s trade policies deal a punishing blow to steelmakers across the world, countries including Mexico, Brazil and Canada are fighting back — but the US isn’t their only target.】

item.title: 随着 Tether 发布在即，锚链将把 Stablecoin 团队扩大一倍
item.description: 安克雷奇数字银行（Anchorage Digital Bank NA）是唯一一家获得美国联邦银行特许的加密原生公司，它计划在明年将其稳定币团队的规模扩大一倍以上，因为数字美元的蓬勃发展和新的立法引发了对人才和产品的抢购。【原文：Anchorage Digital Bank NA, the only crypto-native firm with a federal US banking charter, plans to more than double the size of its stablecoin team over the next year, as a boom in digital dollars and new legislation prompts a rush for talent and products.】

item.title: 据说 LG 电子在暂停后将在印度首次公开募股 13 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，LG 电子公司印度分公司将于 10 月 6 日开始的一周内启动首次公开募股，募集约 1,150 亿卢比（13 亿美元）资金。【原文：LG Electronics Inc.’s India arm is set to launch its initial public offering to raise about 115 billion rupees ($1.3 billion) in the week beginning Oct. 6, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 袭击后俄罗斯黑海码头恢复石油装载
item.description: 乌克兰周三发动空中和海上无人机袭击后，俄罗斯黑海沿岸的两个重要油港一夜之间恢复了油轮装载。【原文：Two key oil ports on Russia’s Black Sea coast resumed loading of tankers overnight after Ukrainian aerial and marine drone attacks on Wednesday.】

item.title: Snap 的 TikTok 反弹是对不可能发生的胜利的赌注
item.description: Snap 公司最近因 TikTok 美国业务转型而引发的反弹，让投资者寄希望于短期的交易，但随着时间的推移，这种希望不太可能实现。【原文：Snap Inc.’s recent rally triggered by a transformation of TikTok’s US operations has investors trading on short-term hopes that are unlikely to materialize as time goes on.】

item.title: 在人工智能数据中心热潮中，谷歌又盯上了加密货币挖矿业务
item.description: Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌将获得购买 Cipher Mining Inc. 5.4% 股份的权利，作为与人工智能计算初创公司 Fluidstack 达成的多年数据中心交易的一部分。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google will receive the right to buy a 5.4% stake in Cipher Mining Inc. as part of a multi-year data center deal with Fluidstack, an artificial intelligence computing startup.】

item.title: 中国在上海设立数字元枢纽以促进全球使用
item.description: 中国央行在上海开设了一个数字人民币运营中心，该中心设有跨境支付、区块链技术和数字资产平台，标志着中国在推动全球采用其货币方面又迈出了一步。【原文：China’s central bank has opened a digital yuan operations center in Shanghai featuring platforms for cross-border payments, blockchain technology and digital assets, marking another step in the country’s push for global adoption of its currency.】

item.title: 美联储会议前国债收益率升至三周高点
item.description: 随着投资者从美国经济数据和美联储官员的言论中寻找利率前景的线索，国债收益率升至三周高点。【原文：Treasury yields edged up to a three-week high as investors looked to US economic data and comments from Federal Reserve officials for clues on the interest-rate outlook.】

item.title: 巴西央行预计 2026 年经济增速将降至 1.5%
item.description: 巴西央行表示，由于利率处于近二十年的高位，经济活动开始受到影响，今年剩余时间和整个 2026 年的经济增长都将放缓。【原文：Brazil’s central bank said economic growth will slow through the rest of this year and all throughout 2026 as interest rates at nearly a two-decade high start to grind on activity.】

item.title: 关税引发的拉动效应损害了可比销售额，CarMax 下跌
item.description: CarMax Inc.盘前股价暴跌，此前该公司公布的可比销售额意外下降，原因是上一季度买家在进口汽车征收关税前匆忙购车。【原文：CarMax Inc. shares plunged premarket after the company reported a surprise drop in comparable sales, as buyers had rushed to purchase vehicles in the previous quarter ahead of a tariff on imported cars.】

item.title: 中国令人瞩目的绿色转型即将变得更加艰难
item.description:
世界第二大经济体已经安装了大量的太阳能和风能设备。这是最简单的部分。【原文：

The world’s second-largest economy has installed vast quantities of solar and wind capacity. That was the easy part.

】

item.title: 星巴克将关闭门店，裁员 10 亿美元进行重组
item.description: 星巴克公司（Starbucks Corp.）表示，在新任首席执行官布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）的领导下，该公司将加大扭亏为盈计划的力度，将关闭门店并裁员 900 人，重组工作耗资 10 亿美元。【原文：Starbucks Corp. said it will close stores and eliminate 900 jobs in a $1 billion restructuring effort as the company amps up a turnaround plan under new Chief Executive Officer Brian Niccol.】

item.title: 库奇内利下跌，因为卖空者莫泊桑提出了俄罗斯诉求
item.description: 布鲁内罗-库奇内利公司（Brunello Cucinelli SpA）股价下跌，此前做空机构 Morpheus Research 声称，该意大利奢侈羊绒品牌在俄罗斯业务方面误导投资者，并进行 "激进的折扣"。【原文：Brunello Cucinelli SpA shares fell after short seller Morpheus Research alleged that the luxury Italian cashmere brand is misleading investors about its Russian business and engaging in “aggressive discounting.”】

item.title: Instagram 的莫塞里看到了人工智能图像浪潮带来的挑战
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）与 Instagram 首席执行官亚当-莫塞里（Adam Mosseri）坐在一起，讨论人工智能将如何影响这款视频分享应用。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner sits down with Instagram chief Adam Mosseri to discuss how artificial intelligence will affect the video sharing app.】

item.title: 美国在最新关税调查中盯上了机器人和医疗设备
item.description: 美国商务部对进口机器人、工业机械和医疗设备展开调查，为在 8 月份全球逐国征收关税的基础上，可能征收更多行业关税奠定了基础。【原文：The US Department of Commerce launched investigations into imports of robotics, industrial machinery and medical devices, laying the groundwork for more potential sectoral tariffs on top of country-by-country levies imposed globally in August.】

item.title: 欧洲不会重启负利率实验
item.description: 我是克雷格-斯特林（Craig Stirling），法兰克福资深经济编辑。今天我们将探讨瑞士的政策困境。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Craig Stirling, a senior economics editor in Frankfurt.
